languageTools.program.agent.expressiongraph

Class ExpressionGraphGenerator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • languageTools.program.agent.expressiongraph.ExpressionGraphGenerator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The node's type
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ActionSpecificationGraphGenerator, GOALProgramGraphGenerator, ModuleGraphGenerator, RuleGraphGenerator
    Deprecated.

    @Deprecated
public abstract class ExpressionGraphGenerator<T>
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic structure for creating an expression graph. The intended structure for subclasses is as follows:
    • Create a subclass for each type of object for which a graph needs to be made, with custom code for createGraph(T, languageTools.program.agent.expressiongraph.ExpressionGraphGenerator<?>) in each of them.
    • If an object for which a graph needs to be made contains (links to) other objects for which a graph needs to be made, call createGraph(T, languageTools.program.agent.expressiongraph.ExpressionGraphGenerator<?>) on a related graph object.
    Author:
    K.Hindriks

      • getKRlanguage

        public final KRlanguage getKRlanguage()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the KRlanguage used to construct the ExpressionGraph.
        Returns:
        The KR language used to construct the expression graph.

      • setKRlanguage

        public final void setKRlanguage(KRlanguage language)
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the KRlanguage that is used to construct the expression graph. The KR language should be the same as the KR language of the agent program that is used to construct this ExpressionGraph.
        Parameters:
        language - The KR language used to construct the expression graph.

      • createGraph

        public final void createGraph(T subject,
               ExpressionGraphGenerator<?> superior)
        Deprecated. 
        Creates a graph for a certain object.
        Parameters:
        subject - The object to for which a graph should be made.
        superior - The superior that is used to get the graph constructed so far and the KR language.

      • doCreateGraph

        protected abstract void doCreateGraph(T subject)
        Deprecated. 
        Does the actual work of making a graph based on the object. Do not call this method but call createGraph(T, languageTools.program.agent.expressiongraph.ExpressionGraphGenerator<?>) instead. createGraph(T, languageTools.program.agent.expressiongraph.ExpressionGraphGenerator<?>) also handles initialization and the issue-free-check afterwards.
        Parameters:
        subject - The object for which a graph should be made.

      • getGraph

        public final ExpressionGraph getGraph()
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the graph that has been constructed so far.
        Returns:
        the expression graph for the GOALProgram.
